content:
=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Overview:
• Genre – It’s an arcade-style space shooter where you pilot a spaceship in a classic shoot‐’em‐up scenario.
• Objective – The goal is to eliminate waves of enemy aliens (and their spawn points) while keeping your avatar (spaceship) alive. Destroying enemies and certain projectiles boosts your score, but collisions can hurt you.
• Mechanics – You control an avatar that shoots projectiles (called “sam”) against aliens. Enemies (of different colors) appear from “portals” that spawn them at varying speeds. These aliens drop bombs that travel downward. There are additional projectiles (like missiles) and a stationary “base” object (a planet) that interacts with both friendly and enemy bullets.
• Key Interactions –
 – Your spaceship (avatar) can bounce back off screen boundaries (EOS rules) to prevent leaving play.
 – Your “sam” shots hit aliens for a bonus (+2 score per hit), but if the base gets hit by sam it and the base are both destroyed (+1 score, though that might be a trade-off).
 – Collisions between your avatar and aliens or enemy bombs result in penalties (–1 score) even though the colliding enemy is destroyed.
 – Bombs hitting the base will wipe out both the base and the bomb.
 – Aliens that reach the end of the screen “turn around,” suggesting they might try to change direction rather than just leaving play.
 – The game ends if you lose your avatar (loss condition) or if all enemy spawning (portals) and aliens are cleared (win condition).
• Win/Loss Conditions –
 – Lose if your spaceship (avatar) is destroyed. 
 – Win if all aliens and their portal spawn points vanish from the level.

Overall Strategy:
– Match mobility with evasive maneuvers. Keep moving to dodge enemy bombs and avoid direct collisions with aliens.
– Prioritize shooting aliens with your “sam” projectiles to maximize score and reduce threats quickly.
– Watch for enemy spawn points (portals) that steadily produce aliens. Eliminating these not only stops further enemy waves but also brings you closer to victory.
– Be cautious around the base. While interactions involving the base may sometimes award points, a misstep (like a bomb hitting the base) can be very costly.
– Manage risk versus reward. Sometimes, hitting an enemy might penalize you (if you crash into it), so aim carefully by firing from a safe distance while keeping an eye on incoming projectiles.

By practicing precise movement and timing your shots, you’ll maximize your score, minimize damage, and clear the level of threats. This blend of fast-paced action and careful strategy is the essence of this classic arcade space shooter.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
background -> '.'
background base -> '0'
background portalSlow -> '1'
background portalFast -> '2'
alienGreen -> '@'
base -> '#'
sam -> '$'
alienGreen bomb -> '%'
bomb -> '&'
bomb sam -> '*'

=== Current State ===

Action:3

I'm moving right to align my spaceship closer to the aliens, which should improve my firing angle according to our strategy.
